document.discussion_title: WWII Talk to take Place at Cattaraugus County Museum
document.topic_text: WWII Talk to take Place at Cattaraugus County Museum August 11th, 2016 Contributed Article Cattaraugus County Museum The Cattaraugus County Museum’s “Summer at the Stone House” event series concludes it’s 2016 run on Thursday, August 25, with a talk given by Steven Appleby on the subject of WWII. Mr. Appleby is retired from the US Army and is the Director of the WWII Museum in Eldred, PA. In this role, Mr. Appleby is passionate about educating the public on the great trials that this country went through during that war and the great sacrifices that were needed to overcome them. The talk will take place at 7:00 and is free and open to the public. The Cattaraugus County Museum is located in the Stone House, 9824 Rt. 16 in Machias. Call 716-353-8200 with any questions. We hope to see you there! Next article
